title: Can we touch the patient with leprosy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hansen’s disease (leprosy) is actually fairly difficult to contract, touching a leper is actually extraordinarily safe. Also most “leper’s” although disfigured by the disease have actually been cured, so they are no longer carriers. Also, Leprosy is of the same family as Tuberculosis and if you have been vaccinated against one, it provides some protection against the other. In colder climates, where TB is more prevalent, Leprosy is rare and vice versa. Which is why Leprosy was always fairly rare in Northern Europe - we tended to get TB (consumption) instead.

Ofcourse one can touch the person with leprosy. The disease has been attached with social stigma e.g person has comitted sin in previous life so previously people use to think these patient are untouchable due to disbelief.But its a myth !!
